metadata.title: CVE-2013-0157 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
(a) mount and (b) umount in util-linux 2.14.1, 2.17.2, and probably otherversions allow local users to determine the existence of restricteddirectories by (1) using the --guess-fstype command-line option or (2)attempting to mount a non-existent device, which generates different errormessages depending on whether the directory exists.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-0157` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdutils - 1:2.34-0.1ubuntu2
fdisk - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
libblkid1 - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
libfdisk1 - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
libmount1 - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
libsmartcols1 - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
libuuid1 - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
mount - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
rfkill - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
util-linux - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
util-linux-locales - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
uuid-runtime - 2.34-0.1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: util-linux package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.26.2-6ubuntu1').
util-linux package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.26.2-6ubuntu1').
